summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney Martin Weinberg and a prosecutor regarding the unsealing of Jeffrey Epstein's indictment, his upcoming court presentation, and logistical details for the defense team. The exchange discusses timing, bail arguments, and the delivery of a search warrant.

persons.name: Martin Weinberg
persons.context: Attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein in the criminal case, coordinating with prosecutors on indictment unsealing, court presentation, and bail strategy.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case U.S. v. Jeffrey Epstein, represented by Martin Weinberg, facing indictment and upcoming court presentation.

persons.name: Reid
persons.context: Mentioned as working with Martin Weinberg; will call the prosecutor in the morning.

connections.description: Weinberg is representing Epstein in the federal criminal case, as indicated in the email discussing indictment and court strategy.
Weinberg mentions "Reid and i will call you in morning," indicating they are working together on the Epstein case.

events.title: Unsealing of Indictment and Court Assignment
events.description: Prosecutors plan to unseal the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein and have the case assigned to a district judge at approximately 9:15 a.m.

events.title: Epstein's Court Presentation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is scheduled to be presented at the U.S. District Court at 500 Pearl Street, interviewed by Pretrial Services, and appear before a judge.

events.title: Grand Jury Indictment Returned
events.description: A grand jury returned an indictment against Jeffrey Epstein, which was emailed to his attorney Martin Weinberg on the evening of July 6, 2019.

locations: U.S. District Court at 500 Pearl Street (New York, NY)
keyFacts: The indictment against Jeffrey Epstein was returned by a grand jury and was provided to his defense attorney on July 6, 2019.
The prosecution planned to unseal the indictment and assign the case to a district judge on the morning of July 8, 2019.
Jeffrey Epstein was scheduled to be presented in court on July 8, 2019, at the U.S. District Court in Manhattan.
Defense attorney Martin Weinberg was coordinating with prosecutors on whether to make a bail argument or consent to detention initially.
A search warrant was executed, and prosecutors noted potential privilege issues regarding items seized.
